articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia used hundreds of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles to attack western, southern and central Ukraine overnight, damaging homes and infrastructure and injuring at least six people, local authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: At least six wounded in large-scale Russian air attack on Ukraine, Ukrainian authorities say

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: The Dalai Lama will address a major three-day gathering of Buddhist religious figures this week ahead of his 90th birthday, as his followers wait for the Tibetan spiritual leader to share details about his succession in a move that could irk China.
articles.title: Dalai Lama set to reveal succession plan as China watches

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he had signed a decree to pull Ukraine out of the Ottawa Convention banning the production and use of anti-personnel mines as a necessary step in view of Russian tactics in their 40-month-old war.
articles.title: Ukraine on track to withdraw from Ottawa anti-personnel mines treaty, Zelenskiy decree shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The pace of talks to resolve the war in Ukraine depends on Kyiv's position, the effectiveness of U.S. mediation, and the situation on the ground, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said in remarks televised on Sunday.
articles.title: Pace of Ukraine talks hinges on efforts of Kyiv, Washington, Kremlin says

articles.author: Howard Goller
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday the 12-day war with Iran had created opportunities for Israel, and the first was the return of hostages held in Gaza by Palestinian militants who attacked Israel on October 7, 2023.
articles.title: Netanyahu sees Iran outcome opening door to Gaza hostage return

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: The jury in the trial of an Australian woman who allegedly murdered three elderly relatives of her estranged husband using poisonous mushrooms retired to consider its verdict on Monday, in a case that has gripped the country.
articles.title: Jury in Australia's mushroom murder trial retires to consider verdict

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military ordered Palestinians to evacuate areas in northern Gaza on Sunday before intensified fighting against Hamas, as U.S. President Donald Trump called for an end to the war amid renewed efforts to broker a ceasefire.
articles.title: Israel orders evacuations in northern Gaza as Trump calls for war to end

articles.author: David Latona, Silvio Castellanos
articles.description: Activists marched in blistering heat through southern Spain's Seville on Sunday, calling for debt cancellation, climate justice and taxing the super rich on the eve of a UN summit on financing development that critics say lacks ambition and scope.
articles.title: Protesters demand debt cancellation, climate action ahead of UN summit

articles.author: David Morgan, Nicole Johnson
articles.description: The measure, Trump's top legislative goal, passed its first procedural hurdle in a 51 to 49 vote, with two Republican senators voting against it.
articles.title: Trump's sweeping tax-cut, spending bill clears first US Senate hurdle

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: The Dalai Lama, the spiritual head of Tibetan Buddhism, has often called himself a simple monk, but for more than 60 years armed with little more than charm and conviction, he has managed to keep the cause of his people in the international spotlight.
articles.title: The Dalai Lama, a tireless advocate for Tibet and its people
